description: Rosy Russula has red to pinkish-red cap (5-15 cm), often fading. Gills yellowish. Stem white with pink tones. KEY: RED CAP, YELLOW GILLS, BRITTLE FLESH, large size. Flesh white. Spore print yellow-ochre. Mild taste.
habitat: Mycorrhizal with conifers, especially pine and spruce. Grows on ground in coniferous forests, especially northern bogs and wet areas. Scattered.
lookalikes: Other red Russulas - check gill color
safety_notes: EDIBLE: Mild flavor. RED CAP + YELLOW GILLS + BRITTLE FLESH + MILD TASTE diagnostic. Cook thoroughly.
